chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, even as unto babes in Christ.
items.plainText: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, even as unto babes in Christ.

items.text: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able to bear it, neither yet now are ye able.
items.plainText: I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were not able to bear it, neither yet now are ye able.

items.text: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?
items.plainText: For ye are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you envying, and strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?

items.text: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollos; are ye not carnal?
items.plainText: For while one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollos; are ye not carnal?

items.text: Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?
items.plainText: Who then is Paul, and who is Apollos, but ministers by whom ye believed, even as the Lord gave to every man?

items.text: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.
items.plainText: I have planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.

items.text: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.
items.plainText: So then neither is he that planteth any thing, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.

items.text: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.
items.plainText: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and every man shall receive his own reward according to his own labour.

items.text: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God's husbandry, ye are God's building.
items.plainText: For we are labourers together with God: ye are God's husbandry, ye are God's building.

items.text: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.
items.plainText: According to the grace of God which is given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and another buildeth thereon. But let every man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.

items.text: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.
items.plainText: For other foundation can no man lay than that is laid, which is Jesus Christ.

items.text: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;
items.plainText: Now if any man build upon this foundation gold, silver, precious stones, wood, hay, stubble;

items.text: Every man's work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man's work of what sort it is.
items.plainText: Every man's work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it shall be revealed by fire; and the fire shall try every man's work of what sort it is.

items.text: If any man's work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.
items.plainText: If any man's work abide which he hath built thereupon, he shall receive a reward.

items.text: If any man's work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.
items.plainText: If any man's work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.

items.text: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
items.plainText: Know ye not that ye are the temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?

items.text: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which temple ye are.
items.plainText: If any man defile the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, which temple ye are.

items.text: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.
items.plainText: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seemeth to be wise in this world, let him become a fool, that he may be wise.

items.text: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.
items.plainText: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

items.text: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.
items.plainText: And again, The Lord knoweth the thoughts of the wise, that they are vain.

items.text: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;
items.plainText: Therefore let no man glory in men. For all things are yours;

items.text: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;
items.plainText: Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;

items.text: And ye are Christ's; and Christ is God's.
items.plainText: And ye are Christ's; and Christ is God's.
